diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Perforated appendicitis with multiple abdominal abscesses
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute right lower quadrant abdominal pain that progressed to sharp and constant pain, along with physical examination findings of mild tenderness in the right lower quadrant without guarding or peritonitis. Imaging revealed a staple line in the right lower quadrant and signs suggesting complications consistent with perforated appendicitis, including the presence of a drain and dilated proximal small bowel.
